Name: Amulet in the form of a heart
Description: This object in basalt was part of the Raife collection and then of the Ã‰. de Meester de Ravestein collection. It constitutes an amulet in the form of a heart of which the front side bears an inscription on nine lines. Apart from the name of the owner, the hieroglyphic text contains Chapter 30 of the Book of the Dead, the formula for making sure that the heart of the deceased doesn't rebel against him in the Afterlife.
